intro: Spermachiton, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Spermachiton is well adapted to various soil types and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It plays an important ecological role by supporting pollinators and providing habitat for native wildlife.
